intro: Ornithogalum synadelphicum, commonly known as the star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features strap-like, linear leaves that are often bluish-green in color. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. It is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
